rows.title: Power of three

transcript.eng:
Close your eyes.
Let's use the magic power of 3 to stay present and relax. 

Name 3 sounds you can hear right now.
Name 3 smells you can smell right now.
Name your 3 favourite foods.
What are 3 things you can be gratefful for right now.

At the end of a touch day, thinking of 3 things to be grateful for can help us find the courage to try again tomorrow.

text_1.eng: Let’s take a moment for YOU. Looking after yourself well starts with noticing how you feel.

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Great! So good to hear you are in a positive space.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Things are not always easy. But that is how we can grow and learn every day!

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Life can be hard. Whatever you are feeling, you can be proud of yourself for being here!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Today’s topic is about helping your child learn and grow.

Play helps children learn what is expected and how to get along with others. It supports their development, both in school and at home.

This is true for all children, including those who are shy, have a disability, or struggle to keep up in class.

media_title.eng: Did you know that playing is the best way to relax AND learn? Tap play to learn more

media_transcript.eng:
Greetings everyone!
Do you know what is the best way to relax? Playing! 

And let’s be honest, which child does not like to play? 

Learning takes time, but there is a lot that you can do as a parent to help your child. Let them play and explore. Let them ask questions and learn from mistakes. And be patient. Your support will help them grow and develop.

Greetings everyone!
Do you know what is the best way to relax? Playing! 

And let’s be honest, which child does not like to play? 

Learning takes time, but there is a lot that you can do as a parent to help your child. Let them play and explore. Let them ask questions and learn from mistakes. And be patient. Your support will help them grow and develop.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
@data.characters.f3_mother.name knows that children learn best by playing. 
She wants to help her son, @data.characters.f3_son_4.name, grow and stay curious by spending more time playing together. Let’s see how she does it.

character_1_text.eng: Hi @data.characters.f3_son_4.name, would you like to do something fun together?

rows.text_1_facilitator:
@data.characters.f3_mother.name knows that children learn best by playing. 
She wants to help her son, @data.characters.f3_son_4.name, grow and stay curious by spending more time playing together. Let’s see how she does it.
rows.character_1_text: Hi @data.characters.f3_son_4.name, would you like to do something fun together?

character_1_text.eng: What would you like to do?

character_2_text.eng: Build a house out of bed sheets!

character_3_text.eng: Great idea! What do we need to do first?

rows.character_1_text: What would you like to do?
rows.character_2_text: Build a house out of bed sheets!
rows.character_3_text: Great idea! What do we need to do first?

character_1_text.eng: First, we hang one bed sheet from the top bunk bed. It’s our first wall! Then, maybe we can use a pillow at the bottom.

character_2_text.eng: It's lovely to see you thinking everything through so carefully.

rows.character_1_text: First, we hang one bed sheet from the top bunk bed. It’s our first wall! Then, maybe we can use a pillow at the bottom.
rows.character_2_text: It's lovely to see you thinking everything through so carefully.

character_1_text.eng: Well done, @data.characters.f3_son_4.name! This is a wonderful bedsheet house.

character_2_text.eng: Can we read our bedtime story here tonight?

rows.character_1_text: Well done, @data.characters.f3_son_4.name! This is a wonderful bedsheet house.
rows.character_2_text: Can we read our bedtime story here tonight?

text_1_facilitator.eng: @data.characters.f3_mother.name helped her son learn by playing together. Let’s explore how she did this.

text_2.eng:
@data.characters.f3_mother.name helped her son learn new skills by:
- ⚽ **Playing with him**: This let @data.characters.f3_son_4.name learn through doing. @data.characters.f3_mother.name didn’t need to show him how to build a house, he figured it out on his own.
- 🏆 **Letting him lead**: She allowed him to ask questions and explore. Curiosity helps children become confident and creative.
- 👏🏾 **Praising him**: She showed him that being curious and trying ideas is a good thing.

quiz_1_question.eng: What did @data.characters.f3_son_4.name learn when his mother played with him?

quiz_1_option_1_text.eng: How to lead and give instructions

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng:
Yes! Actually, he learned all of these things! 

By leading the game, @data.characters.f3_son_4.name learned how to give clear instructions and be in charge. This is a very important skill for the future!

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng:
Yes! Actually, he learned all of these things! 

By using his imagination, @data.characters.f3_son_4.name finds a new way to use a bed sheet. In his mind, it could be a castle or a rocketship. Being creative helps children build important skills for the future.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng:
Yes! Actually, he learned all of these things! 

By imagining a new kind of tent and solving a problem, @data.characters.f3_son_4.name is building important skills for school and life.

quiz_1_feedback_4.eng:
Yes! Actually, he learned all of these things! 

By testing and trying different things to build a fort, @data.characters.f3_son_4.name is learning about shapes and how science works in real life.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
We learned from @data.characters.f3_mother.name and her son how children can learn through play.  

Did you know that children (just like us) can also learn a lot from their mistakes?

Let’s look at how @data.characters.f3_uncle.name supports @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name to learn from her mistake when she plays a bit too rough indoors.

character_1_text.eng: @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name, please walk slowly in the house! You’re going to break something.

character_2_text.eng: I am just going to get my book quickly!

rows.text_1_facilitator:
We learned from @data.characters.f3_mother.name and her son how children can learn through play.  

Did you know that children (just like us) can also learn a lot from their mistakes?

Let’s look at how @data.characters.f3_uncle.name supports @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name to learn from her mistake when she plays a bit too rough indoors.
rows.character_1_text: @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name, please walk slowly in the house! You’re going to break something.
rows.character_2_text: I am just going to get my book quickly!

text_2.eng: @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name runs into a table and breaks a vase. @data.characters.f3_uncle.name sees and is concerned.

rows.text_2: @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name runs into a table and breaks a vase. @data.characters.f3_uncle.name sees and is concerned.

character_2_text.eng: No, @data.characters.f3_uncle.role_name. I’m so, so sorry for breaking the vase… I didn’t see it.

rows.character_2_text: No, @data.characters.f3_uncle.role_name. I’m so, so sorry for breaking the vase… I didn’t see it.

character_1_text.eng: I am not happy that you broke the vase, but thank you for realising your mistake and saying sorry. Do you know how you could have prevented that from happening?

character_2_text.eng: Yes, I should have listened. I continued running even after you asked me to walk in the house.

rows.character_1_text: I am not happy that you broke the vase, but thank you for realising your mistake and saying sorry. Do you know how you could have prevented that from happening?
rows.character_2_text: Yes, I should have listened. I continued running even after you asked me to walk in the house.

character_1_text.eng: It’s OK, @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name. I’m proud that you are able to learn from your mistakes. Let’s get a broom to sweep up the pieces. We may be able to repair the vase with some glue.

rows.character_1_text: It’s OK, @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name. I’m proud that you are able to learn from your mistakes. Let’s get a broom to sweep up the pieces. We may be able to repair the vase with some glue.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Let’s look at how @data.characters.f3_uncle.name helped @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name learn from her mistake!

text_2.eng: When @data.characters.f3_uncle.name stays calm, gives instructions, and shows care, he teaches @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name how to take responsibility and learn from mistakes.

quiz_1_question.eng:
What does @data.characters.f3_uncle.name do to support @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name? 
Try all the options to learn more!

quiz_1_option_1_text.eng: He gives an instruction to prevent the mistake

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng:
Yes, he warns her in order to avoid the mistake. 
All of these options are true!

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng:
Yes, when your child makes a mistake it is important to stay calm. 
All of these options are true!

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng:
Yes, when the accident happens, he first asks if @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name is okay! 
All of these options are true!

quiz_1_option_4_text.eng: He thanks @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name for recognising her mistake

quiz_1_feedback_4.eng:
Yes, praise helps our children to take more responsibility for their actions next time. 
All of these options are true!

quiz_1_option_5_text.eng: He asks @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name to reflect on her behaviour

quiz_1_feedback_5.eng:
Yes, he helps her learn by asking her how she could have prevented the mistake. 
All of these options are true!

quiz_1_option_6_text.eng: He involves @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name to resolve the situation together

quiz_1_feedback_6.eng:
Yes, by asking her to help clean up, he shows how she can make things right again after making a mistake. 
All of these options are true!

quiz_2_option_1_text.eng: It is okay to make mistakes

quiz_2_feedback_1.eng: Exactly! @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name learns important things because @data.characters.f3_uncle.name responds in a calm and supportive way.

quiz_2_option_2_text.eng: I am still loved even if I make mistakes

quiz_2_feedback_2.eng: Exactly! @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name learns important things because @data.characters.f3_uncle.name responds in a calm and supportive way.

quiz_2_option_3_text.eng: I can learn from my mistakes

quiz_2_feedback_3.eng: Exactly! @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name learns important things because @data.characters.f3_uncle.name responds in a calm and supportive way.

quiz_2_feedback_4.eng: Exactly! @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name learns important things because @data.characters.f3_uncle.name responds in a calm and supportive way.

quiz_2_option_5_text.eng: I can help to make things right again

quiz_2_feedback_5.eng: Exactly! @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name learns important things because @data.characters.f3_uncle.name responds in a calm and supportive way.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Here are some tips to help you support your child as they learn and develop important skills.

section_1_text.eng:
Play helps children develop important physical and social skills. 

Set aside time to play games with your child, be creative, and have fun together. Remember, through play, you also learn what kind of support your child may need.

section_1_extra_text.eng:
You can support your child to play and make friends with other children, so they learn how to interact with others well. 

If your child starts to feel overwhelmed with anything in their day, help them reduce their stress by taking a pause and playing together.

section_2_text.eng:
Learning new things takes time. Be patient and encourage your child to keep trying, even when things feel hard. 

Stay calm when they get angry or frustrated – your child will learn to do the same over time.

section_2_extra_text.eng:
You can support them by praising them for trying, and helping them break large tasks into smaller tasks that are appropriate for their age.

Use play to help your child learn difficult skills, like losing, sharing, or taking turns.

section_3_text.eng: Children learn by asking questions and exploring the things they are interested in. Give your child time and space to do this, and be patient when they make mistakes. We all learn from our mistakes!

section_3_extra_text.eng:
Your child may talk a lot and have many questions –  including difficult ones. You can give your child short but honest answers. 

If you need a break or more information, you can take a pause and tell your child you will respond to them later.

rows.section_1_text:
Play helps children develop important physical and social skills. 

Set aside time to play games with your child, be creative, and have fun together. Remember, through play, you also learn what kind of support your child may need.

If your child starts to feel overwhelmed with anything in their day, help them reduce their stress by taking a pause and playing together.

Your child may talk a lot and have many questions –  including difficult ones. You can give your child short but honest answers. 

If you need a break or more information, you can take a pause and tell your child you will respond to them later.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Now that you’ve learned tips to support your child’s learning through play, let’s come up with some practical ideas to try out!

quiz_1_question.eng: What could you do to encourage your child to play and learn?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: That’s right! Join in on any play activity your child is doing. You will strengthen your bond and encourage your child to play and learn more.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Great idea. Try to look for opportunities to play and learn, like collecting leaves or rocks on the way home from school.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Yes! Get creative. Anything in your home could be a musical instrument, costume, or item in a role-play.

quiz_1_feedback_4.eng: Exactly. If you are not sure how you could play together, your child will have many ideas for what you could do.

quiz_1_feedback_5.eng: Wonderful! No matter what you choose, spending time playing with your child is what truly matters. You will help them develop key skills and broaden their imagination. Well done!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Want to help your child develop and grow?

This week's home activity is to invite your child to play with you. Encourage them to ask questions and explore new things through play.

media_title.eng: Play helped @data.characters.media_female_14.name and her son become closer. Tap play to hear how

media_transcript.eng:
My son was not really talking. I was worried about it but did not know how I could help him.

@global.app_name gave me lots of ideas for what I could do to help him develop at home. By playing together, we were able to practise many words in a fun way. He is speaking much more now, and we are closer because of the time we spend together.

quiz_1_question.eng: Could you make time to play and learn with your child this week?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: That’s great! Even a few minutes of play each day can help your child learn and feel close to you.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: That’s okay. Even a few minutes a day can make a big difference. Try finding a small moment that works for you.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: That’s okay. Try starting with one small moment, like sitting and watching your child play or asking what they’re building. Every little bit helps!
